abstract: House lawmakers on Thursday debated whether executive pay should be curbed at all companies — and not just at financial institutions receiving a federal lifeline.
snippet: House lawmakers on Thursday debated whether executive pay should be curbed at all companies — and not just at financial institutions receiving a federal lifeline.
lead_paragraph: Less than a day after the Obama administration announced a plan to set executive pay levels at bailed-out companies like Citigroup and Bank of America, a dispute broke out among members of a House panel over the issue of regulating corporate compensation.

headline.main: Should Pay Curbs Go Beyond the TARP?
